title.value: Bug Characterization in Machine Learning-based Systems
title.quote: Bug Characterization in Machine Learning-based Systems

extractions.description: The paper investigates the characteristics of bugs in ML-based software systems and the difference between ML and non-ML bugs from the maintenance viewpoint. The study involved analyzing 386 closed issues gathered from 40 open-source ML-based software systems using TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch, focusing on bugs affecting the functionality of ML components.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical study analyzing bugs in ML-based systems.
type.quote: We present the first comprehensive empirical study on the characteristics of the bug in ML-based systems, from the software maintenance point of view.

name.justification: The paper focuses on characterizing bugs in machine learning-based systems, particularly deep learning systems, which falls under the broader field of Software Engineering.
name.quote: Keywords Software Bug · Software Testing · ML-based Systems · ML Bug · Deep Learning · Software Maintenance · Empirical Study

name.justification: One of the three most popular ML frameworks studied in the paper.
name.quote: To identify relevant ML issues, this study focuses on projects developed using the three most popular ML frameworks: TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper appears to be the first to reference this specific framework, so no prior papers are referenced.
